intro: Menarda capillaris, commonly known as narrowleaf ironweed, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows up to 2 meters tall, with slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its showy purple to pink composite flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Menarda capillaris is often found in moist to wet habitats such as marshes and stream banks.
